title: Netflix's 'Dear White People' has a message for you in first trailer
text:
Netflix's 'Dear White People' has a message for you in first trailer Kelly Lawler , USA TODAY 12:50 p.m. ET Feb. 8, 2017 44 Shares 
Dear White People is back. 
The critically acclaimed indie film , which explores race relations on a college campus, is finding a second life as a Netflix show . The streaming service unveiled a first look at the revamped story, with actress Logan Browning taking over the lead role from Tessa Thompson, at a panel event in New York Wednesday. The brief clip should be familiar to fans of the movie, showing Browning as protagonist Sam White addressing dos and don'ts of Halloween costumes on her radio show. 
The movie's director, Justin Simien, explained at the event that the 10-episode first season of the show will follow a different character for each episode. 
“You can’t really see the whole until you see the points of view that bring each character together,” he said. “I really wanted to take advantage of the Netflix streaming format, and create something that is specific to this platform.” 
Dear White People hits Netflix April 28. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2kOLOfX Most Popular
